data.system_settings: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Asus Netbook F551C, Intel Core i3 64bits
data.actual_result: All visible GIFs restart from first frame everytime a new GIF gets in view
data.expected_result: When a new GIF gets in view, it shouldn't cause all the other GIFs that were already in view to restart
data.short_description: When there are several GIFs posted in a row in a channel and you scroll up, all GIFs will restart everytime a new GIF gets in view
data.steps_to_repro: - Find a GIF image (preferably with long duration so you can observe the bug more easily) - Make sure Autoplay GIFs is enabled - Post it 5-6 times in a channel. Make it so the first GIFs you posted go offscreen - Now scroll up slowly to show the gifs that are offscreen. While doing that, observe the GIFs at the bottom.
